title: Having issues with learning_phase_flags
body:
Hi!
First of all - great work on shap!

I have encountered some issues with the auto detection of learning phase flags when using a keras model. I was trying to use the InceptionV3 pretrained model from keras with the shap Imagenet50 dataset but the code in deep_tf.py does not locate the correct Placeholder ops from the batch_normalization layers and this error is given:

tensorflow.python.framework.errors_impl.InvalidArgumentError: You must feed a value for placeholder tensor 'batch_normalization_1/keras_learning_phase' with dtype bool

I think this is because the deep_tf.py code has these conditions:

if 'learning_phase' in op.name and op.type == "Const" and len(op.outputs[0].shape) == 0

I can hack it to only look for op.type == "Placeholder" and get past this. I also tried passing a Placeholder tensor when creating the DeepExplainer object but got another error (self.learning_phase_flags does not exist).

I don't specifically need shap to work with InceptionV3 as I was just exploring but thought it was worth reporting.
